lines.text: You said, "I love you," I said, "Wait." I was going to say, "Take me," you said, "Go away."
We played with life and lost.
Either it's raining, or I'm dreaming.
Catherine's plunge into the river so astonished Jim that he drew it the next day, though he didn't usually draw. Admiration for Catherine welled up in him and he sent her a kiss in his mind.
Are you hurt? Then I'll stop being hurt. We mustn't ever both suffer at once.
Sulfuric acid, for the eyes of men who tell lies.
But not this one, Jim. Okay?
If I'd known she might still come, I'd have waited til midnight.

[voice over]
But it was not allowed
Jim took it for granted that she belonged to Jules. Catherine wore that calm smile. It was natural and said everything.
